title: G.C.E. Advanced Level (A/L) - Bio Science Stream
description: A strong foundation in the Bio Science stream, particularly in Chemistry and Biology, is essential for university admission to a nutrition and dietetics program.

title: Degree in Nutrition / Dietetics
description: Complete a 4-year Bachelor's degree. In Sri Lanka, the key degree is BSc (Hons) in Nutrition & Dietetics or a related field like Food Science & Nutrition. This provides the core scientific knowledge.

title: Internship and Professional Registration
description: Complete a supervised practical training or internship (typically 6-12 months) in a clinical setting like a hospital. Register with the Nutrition Society of Sri Lanka or other relevant professional bodies to enhance credibility.

title: Practicing Nutritionist / Dietitian
description: Work as a nutritionist or dietitian. Clinical dietitians work in hospitals with patients. Public health nutritionists work in community settings or for NGOs. You can also work in the food industry or for wellness companies.

title: Senior Dietitian / Private Consultant
description: With experience, you can become a senior dietitian managing a hospital's nutrition department. Many also build a reputation and start their own private practice, consulting with individual clients. A Master's degree (MSc) can lead to roles in academia or research.
qualifications: MSc in Human Nutrition or a specialized area
institutes: N/A - Based on experience and reputation
